ygData.subject: Need help with Graphviz
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi all, I was trying to use Graphviz to get path diagrams for my mechanism..Since my mechanism is huge, the diagram is unreadable..I was reading up on the .dot

Subject: Need help with Graphviz
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=228646714; y=QGWGSQMyA8y8qMl_38fCKItYgBn3SGlLsup4MwGgdzsDPhP7_yiNw0p-d8M
X-Yahoo-Profile: bhupindersingh_99

Hi all,

I was trying to use Graphviz to get path diagrams for my 
mechanism..Since my mechanism is huge, the diagram is 
unreadable..I was reading up on the .dot file format to figure out 
how to change some of its parameters to make the diagram readable 
usint dot.exe and neato.exe..the diagram improved but its still 
not good enough.

Does anyone know the properties that I should set for a huge 
mechanism(600 reactions, 100 species) to get a readable path 
diagram?

Also, since rate of a reaction depends on concentration of 
species, and rate constant (which in turn depends on temperature), 
shouldn't the diagrams be different for different species 
concentrations?? (I got similar diagrams when I tried running the 
converters for different species concentrations)..do we select 
species only to include or exclude them from the mechanism path 
diagram??

For Example here's my rxnpath.py file..

from Cantera import *
from Cantera import rxnpath
from Cantera.gases import *

gas = Air()
x = [5] * gas.nSpecies()
gas.setState_TPX(1800.0, 1.01325e5, x)

#gas = GRI30()
#gas.set(P = OneAtm, T = 1000.0, X = 'O2:1,H:1, H2:1, N2:3.76, 
CH4:1')
rxnpath.write(gas, 'N', 'tp6.dot')
print 'done'

#To convert use command..C:\Program Files\ATT\Graphviz\bin>dot 
-Tgif tp6.dot -o tp6.gif

I got similar results even after I changed [5] to [0.1] in x = 
[5]*gas.nSpecies()

Can anyone help on this??

Bhupinder

--
Bhupinder Singh
Department of Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering
University of Florida
Gainesville
